title: Over a week waiting on a support ticket... Hey, can I get an assist?
body:
Heyya, hoping that a Red sees this. It's me, friendly neighborhood Jason.

My account was recently banned for third-party addons. I'd never used anything close to breaking the ToS, so figured it was a mistake, but ended up finding out there were some games on my account's recent activity that I definitely didn't play. So... it appears my account was compromised unfortunately.

Knowing how these tickets usually go, and after the years I've put into the community of OCE League of Legends with hosting, running grassroots esports events, shoutcasting, and just helping out where I can, I'm not worried that I won't get my account back.

I am, however, getting a little bit impatient. TFT has bought me back into the game, and I'm eager to start playing again. I am in the meantime stuck on my smurf account, which barely has half of all heroes unlocked ( not to mention missing my rad summoner name and expensive skins collection ).

Is there a lot going on with player support at the moment? I'm hoping for an answer soon.

<3 s.

I originally submitted an AR Ticket, and got bumped to player behavior. I haven't responded to the ticket as that'd bump me back to the top of the waiting list for it.

Done this. I haven't logged in to LoL in maybe a few months? ( I last remember playing URF mode a month or two after it came out ) and haven't played from any machines that aren't mine in quite some time, so I'm really not sure where this could have come from other than just randomness.


> You should also look into any important accounts (emails, banks etc) just to make sure they're secure and aren't being affected by the same or similar compromises. The website https://haveibeenpwned.com/ is a great way to help track down compromises, so checking that out might be a good idea as well.

I'll give that a shot. There's only one other account I've found has been compromised, as it shared the same password I use for League, and another 5ish services and games with the same password were untouched.

Presumably, that means you replied to the PB teams response and have since received no answer? I'm just trying to get the whole picture here.

Did you reply by email or through the web portal? If you replied via email could you perhaps check the web portal to make sure the ticket hasn't been closed for some reason?

Assuming we've got at least most of the picture here I don't believe there's any reason such an account ban should stand. If you'd been compromised a bunch before that's one thing, but it sounds like this is a first.

1. This is the first time I've been compromised on LoL ( Which sucks because I'm gonna have to learn a new password for the first time in years for LoL )

2. I received a response that I was passed to player behaviour, and have not responded, to keep my place in the ladder as high as possible. I effectively communicated my position in the first email and didn't need to change anything, so long as they got around to it and understood the problem.

I'm not worried about losing my account, I know how far player support goes for their players, I'm just upset it's taking so long....

Hmm odd. If you don't get an answer in the next day I'd probs reply just to ask what's going on. You shouldn't be waiting this long even if support is busy.

EDIT: Account compromise does take a lot of investigation and much more time than the average ticket, and with TFT bringing a lot of old players back, it's also very possible that these teams are just swamped.

So, as far as I know there is a high volume of requests at the moment, but a week is still a lot. If you've bumped (replied to) the ticket, I would refrain from doing so since it'll bump you back down the queue. If you haven't, I'd do so just once because it's sound like your ticket has gotten lost in the mess somewhere.

Even when support is busy they typically reply within 48 hours, but it's possible there's conflicting tickets or some such given this is an account recovery.

Did you submit a general ticket or an account recovery ticket? If you haven't already submitted the AR ticket I'd recommend doing so now since that's usually the first thing they ask you to do in such scenarios. Once the account is secure and ownership is confirmed they should reverse any punishments issued as a result.

Since it's a case of possible compromise, I'd definitely recommend running an anti-virus scan on any personal computers you use if you haven't already. If you've used any computers belonging to friends/family recently it would also be a good idea to recommend they do the same. Better to be safe than sorry. Quick note; I'd personally recommend Malwarebytes Anti-Malware (free version) for manual scans, as it tends to pick up things that other anti-virus software miss in my experience, but up to you.

You should also look into any important accounts (emails, banks etc) just to make sure they're secure and aren't being affected by the same or similar compromises. The website https://haveibeenpwned.com/ is a great way to help track down compromises, so checking that out might be a good idea as well.
